page.title: 12THE LITTLE BADDOW FRESCO
page.content: Inside St.Marys church,on the north wall of the nave,is a magnificent fresco of St.Christopher.Although it is now faded in parts it is still rich in medieval colour.The fresco was painted about 1370 and shows the Saint carrying the Christ child across the water.Fish ,a hermit,and a chapel have also been included on the fresco. In medieval times wall frescos, rood screens and glass were painted or stained with Biblical scenes and provided a visual interpretation of the Bible for many of the peasants, villiens and bordars.These folk attended church but few of them could read or understand the Latin services and so relied on pictorial images for their religion. .
